page.title: 16SATURDAY, 29th June, 1985.
page.content: This was St Peter's Day. It began with people going to work, shopping, doing housework and gardening. A Monxton family was moving house and there was a wedding in Monxton Church at one o'clock. At 2.30pm. Amport Cricket Club 1st Eleven opened their league match against Bentworth in Hampshire County Division 3. One player only actually lives in Amport! Amport Church Fete was opened at 2.30pm. on the Green. Amport School children performed Country and Maypole dancing having already danced at Cricklade College, Andover, that morning to celebrate International Youth Year. An Open Flower Show, side- shows and competitions entertained the public. A train made by REME gave rides around Amport House grounds. Over Â£500 was raised.
